Interface GraphicsContext

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    GraphicsContextAwt
    public interface GraphicsContext
    This class allows graphics to be drawn for the game without having to know whether we're using AWT or a different UI or graphics implementation. It's best to keep this interface is minimal as possible, so there's fewer possible issues in porting to the web.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      double aspectRatio()
      Gets the aspect ratio of the target window.
      void fillRect​(double x, double y, double w, double h)
      Fills a rectangle with the current foreground color.
      void setColor​(java.awt.Color color)
      Sets the color to be displayed by the next draw operation.

    • Method Detail

      • aspectRatio

        double aspectRatio()
        Gets the aspect ratio of the target window.
        Returns:
        The width to height ratio of the target window.

      • fillRect

        void fillRect​(double x,
              double y,
              double w,
              double h)
        Fills a rectangle with the current foreground color.
        Parameters:
        x - The horizontal offset, from 0 to 1.
        y - The vertical offset, from 0 to 1.
        w - The width, relative to the window size, to make the rectangle.
        h - The height, relative to the window size, to make the rectangle.

      • setColor

        void setColor​(java.awt.Color color)
        Sets the color to be displayed by the next draw operation.
        Parameters:
        color - The color to assign the next draw operation.
